Name: Message in a Bottle
Description: If you come across a message in a bottle, don't hesitate to check it out. Who knows, it might be one with precious dreams and hopes inside...
QuestDesc: If you come across a message in a bottle, don't hesitate to check it out. Who knows, it might be one with precious dreams and hopes inside...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drift away. Drift away. Take with you the world I convey...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm making a message in a bottle. I plan to put my entire world inside of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This bottle here is more than enough to make my world blossom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My younger brother and I had a passion for music since we were children. We'd practice singing and composing together every day. His talent shone bright, and he ended up joining the Order as a court musician.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But later, my brother confided in me his desire to chase his dreams. He boarded a Pilgrim's Sail seeking distant shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since then, we've had no contact. When I heard the rumors about the Pilgrim's Sails, I thought...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It wasn't until the Carnevale, when the troupe's melodies washed over me, that I felt a sense of deep familiarity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just knew it was his voice, his music. He had become a great composer!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know him better than anyone. He's always chased his dreams, and I'm so proud of him. It made me wonder...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It made me wonder about my own dreams long buried and a childhood lost in the tides. So, I wrote it all in this bottle.

Options.PlotLineKey: A bottle filled with your entire world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, but I have second thoughts. Should I really cast this bottle into the sea and chase after my own dreams?

Options.PlotLineKey: You should go after your dreams.
I think you already know the answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, your're right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think I do want to give it to the sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you mind if we place it in the water together?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope it can carry my world far, far away, reaching wherever my brother is now. With that in mind, we should find a spot with a favorable wind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This spot will do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You watch Nannerl gently place the bottle into the water. A gentle breeze sweeps by as you watch the waves carry the bottle out to sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drift away. Drift away. Take with you the world I convey...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Along with my forgotten childhood and the dreams I abandoned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Find your way to my brother, so that he may know of his sister's love.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And tell him, following his music, Nannerl has put her world into this bottle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, she will pursue the dreams she once cast aside. She will continue to learn music and compose!

Options.PlotLineKey: You're already on a path of your choosing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope one day my brother will find this bottle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nannerl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then he will realize how proud his sister is of him, and there will be a day when he will listen to Nannerl's own music.
